articles.title: Top AI Stocks for Investment Success Now 2023 Guide
articles.author: support101@QUE.com
articles.summary: Investing in artificial intelligence (AI) stocks is a popular strategy for those looking to capitalize on groundbreaking innovations. AI technologies continue to transform industries from healthcare to finance. This guide offers insights into the top AI stocks to consider in 2023 for sustainable investment success. The AI sector is booming due to several compelling reasons, making it an attractive area for investors.

articles.title: 'I'm Envious Of The Current Generation Of 20-Year-Old Dropouts,' Says Sam Altman, Admitting He Hasn't Had A 'Real Chunk Of Free Mental Space' In Years
articles.author: Casey B. Renner
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman is envious of the current generation of 20-year-old dropouts who are skipping college to build startups. Altman dropped out of Stanford University in 2005 after two years of studying computer science. He left at 19 to cofound the location-sharing startup Loopt, which was later acquired in 2012 by Green Dot Corporation (NYSE:GDOT). He then became president of Y Combinator and helped launch OpenAI in 2015.

articles.title: Retirement Planning With ChatGPT: 10 Prompts To Try To Get a Real Answer You Can Use
articles.author: John Csiszar
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an artificial intelligence (AI) bot for retirement planning. It's great at gathering information and performing calculations, but it's only as good as the information provided by the user. For most people, it still makes sense to work with a financial advisor.

articles.title: Large reasoning models almost certainly can think
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: There's been a lot of debate about whether large reasoning models (LRM) are unable to think. In this article, I make a bold claim that LRMs almost certainly can think. To understand what it means to think, we need to define what we mean by thinking.

articles.title: Meet NEO: The $20,000 Robot Housekeeper That Can Clean, Dance, and Do Laundry
articles.author: Newsource
articles.summary: By NEO, OneXrobotAI and CNN Newsource, one of the robots is called "housekeeper" and the other "household robot".    i.e. "housekeeping robot" and "housecleaning robot" are examples of these robots.

articles.title: Sam Altman says OpenAI's revenue is ‘well more' than reports of $13 billion a year and hints it could hit $100 billion by 2027
articles.author: Jason Ma
articles.summary: OpenAI's annual revenue is $13 billion. The company has announced massive AI infrastructure deals in recent weeks with companies like Nvidia, Broadcom and Oracle. Microsoft's latest quarterly results included a $4 billion charge that imply OpenAI lost $12 billion last quarter. Sam Altman is optimistic about the company's future growth.

articles.title: Usa: Stromfresser Ai – Google & Co. Taking a Radical Step
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence needs a lot of energy. Tech giants such as Google and Microsoft are betting on this technology.   Google, Microsoft and Facebook are among the companies that are investing in artificial intelligence. It is causing controversy in the U.S. because of its high energy consumption.

articles.title: Buck Sexton, Former CIA Officer, Reveals 'Manhattan II'
articles.author: Former CIA Officer Buck Sexton
articles.summary: Buck Sexton is a former CIA officer and radio host. He is promoting the $2.2 Trillion Artificial Superintelligence Initiative. The initiative aims to invest in AI infrastructure, data networks, semiconductor manufacturing, an AI-driven defense shield and energy innovation. President Trump's executive order on AI created a technological renaissance.

articles.title: 4 ChatGPT Prompts To Help Scale Your Company With Purpose
articles.author: Sarah Hernholm
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI tool that helps companies grow more efficiently. It's useful for side hustlers, student founders, and teen entrepreneurs. It helps them clarify their vision, improve operations, amplify brand authority, and anticipate risks before they stall momentum. The best leaders are the ones who use ChatGPT to plan smarter and execute faster.

articles.title: Adapting to AI: How Google's Search Ads Will Evolve with New Technology
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Google confirms that ads will be integrated into its AI-powered search capabilities. The tech giant reported $56.57 billion in ad revenue from Search and YouTube last year. According to statista, global digital ad spend is projected to exceed $685 billion in 2024.

articles.title: AI friendship won't cure America's loneliness crisis
articles.author: Jeremy Tate
articles.summary: Half of Americans say they are lonely and isolated. Sam Altman announced that OpenAI will soon provide erotica for lonely adults. Mark Zuckerberg envisions a future in which solitary people enjoy AI friends. What masquerades as friendship is a dangerous substitute. AI echoes back your concerns, frames its answers around your cues, and never asks anything of you. It can't inspire courage, sit beside you in silence, or offer forgiveness. A chatbot can only mimic what it has never known.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence is not your friend
articles.author: The Blaze
articles.summary: Half of Americans are lonely. Silicon Valley's solution is artificial companionship, chatbots that mimic empathy while real human connection collapses. True friendship requires presence, sacrifice, and community. AI can never offer that, because it's not based on human emotions.

articles.title: The Wolves And The Bees: AI Shows New Evolution
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: Abhishek Singh of the Camera Culture club at the MIT Media Lab talks about the relationship between intelligence and language in a TED talk. He suggests that in the future, AI will speak a language based on data flow rather than words. Singh compares a 'hive mentality' in bees to the communication theory of a higher-level species, like wolves.

articles.author: Jason Ma
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton is a computer scientist and the 'godfather of AI' who has won a Nobel Prize for his work. He believes big companies are betting on replacing human workers with AI to make money. He predicts AI will create massive unemployment and a rise in profits for the capitalist system.

articles.title: Researchers explore how AI can strengthen, not replace, human collaboration
articles.author: Alexander Johnson
articles.summary: Researchers from Carnegie Mellon University's Tepper School of Business are investigating how AI can be used to support teamwork rather than replace teammates. Professor Anita Williams Woolley and her colleagues are trying to figure out where and how AI could play a positive role. Ph.D. student Allen Brown is exploring how people feel taking risks or speaking up in a group.

articles.title: AI-supported robots: between comedy and reality
articles.summary: Andon Labs has conducted an experiment on AI robots. It revealed that current Large Language Models (LLMs) aren't ready to pilot our robotic helpers. Generic chatbots outperformed Google's robot-specific model, Gemini ER 1.5. This finding is crucial for SEO strategies targeting AI and robotics keywords.

articles.title: The application layer strikes back: Cursor's custom LLM
articles.author: Ben Dickson
articles.summary: The AI-assisted coding tool Cursor has released Composer, its first proprietary large language model (LLM) designed for its integrated development environment (IDE). Composer is optimized for speed and is trained specifically for 'agentic' workflows, where autonomous AI agents can plan, write, and test code within a developer's environment. Composer achieves frontier-level intelligence while generating code at 250 tokens per second.

articles.summary: "This is the reason why AI was invented" - Upworthy's video on Michael Jackson's training of Anakin Skywalker is the answer to the question "What if Michael Jackson trained anakin Skywalker?" as explained by Upworthy.

articles.summary: Take-Two CEO Strauss Zelnick believes regenerative AI will create more jobs in the video game industry, despite the fact that thousands of animators and other behind-the-scenes workers have lost their jobs due to the technology. Microsoft laid off 9,000 workers in July. Some of those workers trained AI to create new levels for the mobile video game Candy Crush before they were fired.

Several teens died by suicide following prolonged conversations with AI chatbots on the platform. Character.AI's CEO Karandeep Anand announced this week that the platform would phase out chat access for minors entirely by Nov. 25.

articles.title: Over half a million ChatGPT users weekly are showing signs of PSYCHOSIS
articles.author: Tags
articles.summary: OpenAI has revealed that over half a million of its ChatGPT users weekly are showing signs of mental illness. The company has announced corrective measures and improvements with GPT-5, but mental health experts are skeptical. The crisis is unfolding in an environment with little meaningful AI regulation.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is increasingly present in our day-to-day lives. It's difficult to distinguish whether a photo or a video is real or created with AI. Before there were plagiarisms, but now you can ask a chatbot to write you a news, a letter or an essay on any subject.

articles.title: The Strange Way Suzanne Somers' Husband Is Honoring His Late Wife
articles.author: Cole Hediger
articles.summary: Suzanne Somers died of breast cancer in 2023. Her husband Alan Hamel has been working to create an AI clone of his late wife for his fans. The project was all Suzanne Somers' idea. She suggested it in the 1980s when they met Ray Kurzweil.

articles.author: Raw Story
articles.summary: Fox News has run a report covering a series of AI-generated videos. This isn't a sign of what's to come in the future, but a sign that media outlets are abandoning any notion of objective journalism right now. At the end of September, OpenAI released the Sora 2 video generat…

articles.title: AI Security: CrowdStrike & NVIDIA Stop Machine-Speed Attacks
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: CrowdStrike and NVIDIA are working together to develop an AI-powered security system. CrowdStrike's Falcon Complete Managed Detection and Response (MDR) service handles millions of triage decisions monthly, generating a massive dataset of human expertise that CrowdStrike turns into AI models. NVIDIA's commitment to open-source models offers transparency into the model's workings, weights and security.

articles.title: AI Is Teaching the Next Generation of M.B.A.s the Classic Case Study
articles.author: Lindsay Ellis
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing business education at Northwestern University. For more than a century, M.B.A. students have learned business strategy through the case method. Students pore over pages of charts and reports on executives' perspectives and debate in class the best plan of attack.

articles.title: The 6 Best LLM Tools To Run Models Locally
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: Running large language models (LLMs) usually involves sending data to servers managed by DeepSeek, OpenAI, and other AI model providers. Some businesses prefer to keep their data offline for greater privacy. DeepSeeks Chat, ChatGPT, and Claude are examples of such models.

articles.title: Career education options in AI after class 12: Here are 1-year, 3-year, 4-year and 5-year options
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has become a driving force in shaping modern industries. There is a growing demand for professionals skilled in machine learning, data analytics and automation. There are many options for students after class 12, from short-term certificates to full-fledged engineering degrees.

articles.summary: Everyone's asking the wrong question about an AI bubble. Here are the stocks to buy and when to do it.    iReport.com will let you know what stocks you should buy and what to buy when.  Back to the page you came from.

articles.title: AI researchers 'embodied' an LLM into a robot – and it started channeling Robin Williams
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Andon Labs has published the results of a new AI experiment. They programmed a vacuum robot with various state-of-the-art LLMs as a way to see how ready LLMs are to be embodied. They chose the basic vacuum robot, rather than a complex humanoid, because they wanted the robotic functions to be simple.

articles.title: Veteran analyst says Meta stock is stuck in 'near-term purgatory'
articles.author: Tony Owusu
articles.summary: Mizuho has lowered its price target for Meta Platforms to $815 from $925 per share. The social media company is looking to sell at least $25 billion of investment-grade bonds. CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the company would spend more on AI in the coming year.

articles.title: Teen finds a way to simplify lost and found with an app that uses AI in the search process
articles.author: Kurt Schlosser
articles.summary: Neil Kumar, 15, is the founder of FindIt, an app that uses artificial intelligence to help people find lost and found items. He was selected as one of four winners of Bellevue's Civic Innovation Challenge. The app is currently being used at Odle Middle School in Bellevue. Kumar wants to expand the app to airports, workplaces and public transit agencies.

articles.title: Articul8: Interview With Founder & CEO Arun Subramaniyan About The Enterprise AI Company
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Articul8 AI is an enterprise software company focused on generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) solutions for large, complex organizations. Arun Subramaniyan started his career as an aerospace engineer designing jet engines and rocket systems. He later worked at Amazon and Intel, where he helped build and scale the company's HPC workloads. He was asked to build a new cloud and AI software business at Intel. He secured funding from Intel Capital, DigitalBridge, and others to spin the effort out as an independent company.

articles.title: Nearly one in ten US newspaper articles are partly AI-written, usually without readers' knowledge
articles.summary: 9% of newly published American newspaper articles were at least partly written by artificial intelligence, almost always without disclosure. Nearly one in ten US newspaper articles are partly AI-written, usually without readers' knowledge, according to a study from the University of Maryland.

articles.title: Leveraging Artificial Intelligence to Address the Global Shortage of Doctors
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: The world faces a growing shortage of doctors. Developed countries like the US, UK and Germany are experiencing significant gaps in healthcare access. Artificial intelligence in healthcare is rapidly emerging as a powerful tool. It can be useful in diagnostics, drug discovery and personalized medicine. It is also useful in telemedicine and remote patient monitoring.

articles.title: Xania Monet is the first AI-powered artist to debut on a Billboard airplay chart, but she likely won't be the last
articles.author: Lisa Respers France
articles.summary: Xania Monet is the first AI artist to debut on a Billboard radio chart. She has more than 146,000 followers on Instagram. Monet released a full-length album 'Unfolded' in August and a seven-track EP 'Pieces Left Behind' in September. She's been signed to a multimillion-dollar record deal with Hallwood Media after 'a bidding war'.

articles.title: Xania Monet is the first AI-powered artist to debut on a Billboard airplay chart, but she likely won't be the last
articles.author: Lisa Respers
articles.summary: Xania Monet is the first AI artist to earn enough radio airplay to debut on a Billboard radio chart. She has appeared on the Hot Gospel Songs and the Hot R&B Son charts since her song 'Let Go, Let God' was released in summer 2025.

articles.title: Inside OpenAI's Monetization Engine: Lessons For Scaling AI Pricing In SaaS
articles.author: Scott Woody
articles.summary: Sara Conlon is the Head of Financial Engineering at OpenAI. She explains how her team built a billing organization capable of scaling from zero to billions in revenue in under three years. Her team's guiding principle is a balance between intention and control. Conlon compared her experience at Asana with OpenAI's dynamic, usage-based model.

articles.title: Here Come the Robot Swarms!
articles.author: Jackie Snow
articles.summary: Unlike traditional robots that take orders from a central computer, swarm robots work like ant colonies. No single robot is in charge, but the swarm accomplishes complex tasks through simple interactions between neighbors. Each robot interacts only with those nearby and communicates with sounds or chemical signals in particles they release.

articles.title: Here Come the Robot Swarms!
articles.author: Jackie Snow
articles.summary: The field of swarm robotics is taking inspiration from ants, bees and slime molds. Unlike traditional robots that take orders from a central computer, swarm robots work like ant colonies. This approach could excel where traditional robots fail. For instance, a swarm of drones might one day monitor vast areas to detect early-stage wildfires. They could also manage agricultural operations in places without reliable internet service.

articles.title: AI won't replace lawyers, but it could make legal services more affordable
articles.author: Michelle Mikhels
articles.summary: Millions of Americans face civil legal issues every day. 50 million Americans have household incomes below 125 percent of the poverty threshold. Low-income Americans do not get adequate legal assistance in 92 percent of civil cases. Responsible use of artificial intelligence may be the answer to this problem.

articles.title: New AI browsers boast hands-free browsing — but are vulnerable to dangerous ‘prompt injections.' Here's how to stay safe
articles.author: Sarah Sharkey
articles.summary: New artificial intelligence-powered web browsers aim to change how we browse the web. They are designed to act as autonomous agents, navigating the web and performing actions for you. These browsers can be tricked by hidden commands or malicious prompts disguised within web content. Cybersecurity experts warn that AI browsers represent more risk than traditional browsers.

articles.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show limits of relying on AI at work
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Judges around the world are dealing with AI-generated legal briefs with errors. Many employers want to hire workers who can use AI to help with tasks such as conducting research and drafting reports. Damien Charlotin, a French data scientist and lawyer, catalogued at least 490 court filings in the past six months that contained false or misleading information.

articles.title: YouTube Clarifies No AI Role in Removal of Tech Tutorials Amid Speculation
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: There was a wave of tech tutorials being removed from YouTube in the last week. Many tech channels reported a sudden loss of views and subscriber counts following the removals. YouTube clarifies that no AI was directly responsible for the initial removal of these videos. Removals stemmed from a targeted human review campaign focusing on specific policy areas.

articles.title: Google's AI co-scientist just solved a biological mystery that took humans a decade
articles.author: Eric W. Dolan
articles.summary: Google's AI co-scientist is a multi-agent system built upon the Gemini 2.0 large language model. It operates through a 'scientist-in-the-loop' model, where human experts provide initial research goals, offer feedback, and guide the AI's exploration using natural language.

articles.title: Google's AI co-scientist just solved a biological mystery that took humans a decade
articles.summary: A Google AI developed by Google identified drug candidates that showed significant anti-fibrotic activity in a laboratory model of chronic liver disease. It also independently deduced a complex mechanism of bacterial gene transfer that had taktaken place in the model.

articles.title: AI & Acromegaly: Early Detection & Diagnosis
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Acromegaly is a rare hormonal disorder caused by a benign pituitary tumor. Diagnosis can take up to ten years. AcroFace is an AI-powered system that analyzes facial photographs. It correctly identifies acromegally in 93% of cases.

articles.title: 10 stocks that let you invest like Nvidia in the next hot AI trade
articles.author: Christine Ji
articles.summary: Amphenol, Arista Networks, Astera Labs, Ciena Corp., Coherent Corp., Fabrinet Lumentum Holdings Inc., Macom Technology Solutions Holdings Inc. and Semtech Corp. are well positioned to capitalize on the surging need for connectivity. Most have outperformed the S&P 500.

articles.title: Disable WhatsApp AI: Protect Your Privacy Now!
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: 40% of WhatsApp users have actively minimized or hidden the new Meta AI feature within the app due to privacy concerns and performance concerns. The resistance to AI in WhatsApp foreshadows a shift in how AI will be integrated into our lives. AI developers will need to offer more detailed and customizable privacy settings. Companies will adopt a modular approach, allowing users to opt-in specific AI functionalities.

articles.title: Microsoft and OpenAI set their own rules for AGI
articles.summary: Microsoft and OpenAI have decided to define for themselves what counts as artificial general intelligence (AGI) and when they've supposedly achieved it. The article Microsoft and Open AI set their own rules for AGI appeared first on THE DECODER and is of interest to The Decoder.

articles.title: Louis Têtu: Why Canada has to get artificial intelligence right
articles.author: Special to Financial Post
articles.summary: Canada's AI Strategy Task Force gave Ottawa a set of recommendations to shape its country's approach to artificial intelligence. AI is poised to create the most significant competitive divide of the past two centuries. Canada's contribution to the science of AI is undeniable. 10 per cent of the world's top-tier AI researchers are here in Canada, the second-highest concentration of any country. Government needs to adopt bold and pragmatic policies to match its ambitions.

articles.title: OpenAI's ChatGPT Atlas has promise, but for now it's unfulfilled
articles.author: Dwight Silverman
articles.summary: ChatGPT Atlas is a chatbot wrapper around Chromium, the open-source browser platform on which Google Chrome and many other browsers are based. It's only available for Apple's Mac laptops and desktops at the moment, but Windows, Android and iOS versions are coming soon. The extension comes close to the experience you see in Atlas, but you still get to keep your favorite features.

articles.title: My new best friend, Mr. AI
articles.author: Pennie Hunt
articles.summary: I was at lunch with a friend over 20 years ago. He tried to explain to me what artificial intelligence (AI) was. I thought he had turned into a sci-fi spewing creature that had gone off the deep end. Now, everything he was talking about has come true.

articles.title: Hunt: My new best friend, Mr. AI

articles.summary: I was at lunch with a friend over 20 years ago. He tried to explain to me what artificial intelligence (AI) was. I thought he had turned into a sci-fi spewing creature that had gone off the deep end. Now, everything he was talking about has come true.

articles.title: Why Our Fear of Technology Is Nothing New—And Why That Should Give Us Hope: From Cuckoo Clocks to ChatGPT
articles.author: Andrew Keen
articles.summary: Vanessa Chang is a technology historian and author of The Body Digital. She argues that our bodies have always been living interfaces between our minds and the world. Every generation has worried about machines colonizing human experience. The danger of AI is allowing corporate interests and proprietary systems to dictate the terms of our technological embodiment without democratic input.

articles.title: OpenAI is the hot buzzword on corporate earnings calls
articles.author: Madison Mills
articles.summary: OpenAI has 31 mentions on major corporate earnings transcripts so far this quarter. It has partnerships with Microsoft, Nvidia, AMD, CoreWeave, Oracle and Broadcom. It also acquired Jony Ive's design firm, io, to develop its own line of AI-native consumer devices. The company is laying the groundwork to go public at a $1 trillion valuation. CEO Sam Altman wants to spend trillions of dollars on AI.

articles.title: It's Here, It's Arrived, Ai Is Now Regulated
articles.author: Magyar Nemzet
articles.summary: The government's goal is to create the legal framework for the safe, transparent and responsible use of artificial intelligence (AI) according to Szabolcs Szolnoki, State Secretary of the Ministry of Education and Science.    .

articles.author: PC Mag
articles.summary: Imagiyo AI Image Generator is on sale now for $49 (reg. $495) with lifetime subscription to Imagiyo's AI Image generator. It's the AI-generated images of your dreams that you can make with this lifetime subscription.

articles.title: Georgia is at a crossroads in global AI race, but here's how state can thrive
articles.author: Pujan Roka
articles.summary: Georgia is at a crossroads in the global AI race. China and the U.S. are competing to gain AI dominance. Georgia has a pivotal role to play. Georgia's data center market is second most active after Northern Virginia. Texas has attracted AI megaprojects on the scale seen in Texas. Georgia does not offer a provision to fast-track AI innovation.

articles.title: I was a diesel mechanic, and now I'm the head of AI at a startup. Here's how I made the switch.
articles.author: Sarah E. Needleman
articles.summary: Daryl Roberts, 30, is a lead AI engineer at Obney.ai, an AI consulting firm near Baton Rouge, Louisiana. He joined the Marine Corps Reserve to get healthcare benefits and a small paycheck. He worked as a diesel mechanic, service administrator, dispatcher, and operations manager. He attended an AI boot camp offered by Louisiana State University. He got his first paid gig using AI to analyze chicken behavior. He has an AI certificate from LSU.

articles.title: New AI browsers read, click and summarize for you — but experts warn they're vulnerable to dangerous ‘prompt injections.' Here's how to stay safe
articles.author: Sarah Sharkey
articles.summary: New artificial intelligence-powered web browsers aim to change how we browse the web. They are designed to act as autonomous agents, navigating the web and performing actions for you. They can be hacked by hidden commands or malicious prompts disguised within web content. Cybersecurity experts warn that AI browsers represent more risk than traditional browsers.

articles.title: Former CEO of Intel Building Special AI to Bring About Second Coming of Christ
articles.author: Frank Landymore
articles.summary: Patrick Gelsinger is the former CEO of Intel and is now the executive chairman of Gloo, a Christian technology company. He is a born-again Christian and has written two books for Christian audiences. He wants to build AI that will reflect Christian values and accelerate the return of the Messiah.

articles.title: Borgman: Raising a brow at beauty app scores
articles.summary: Beauty analysis apps score your face on a scale of 1-10. One app scores hair, skin, jawline, cheekbones, nose, chin and lips. Another uses percentage points to score images for confidence, fun, smartness, trustworthiness and approachability.

articles.title: Sam Altman Renames GPT-6 to GPT-6-7 in Viral Post, Here's What It Means
articles.author: Priya Pathak
articles.summary: The next version of ChatGPT will be called GPT-6-7. The name change is linked to a popular internet slang term '6 and 7' that has gone viral among Gen Alpha - the youngest generation online. OpenAI has been rolling out new features and updates across its platform.

articles.title: Is Qiagen's (QGEN) Automation Push a Sign of Expanding Moat or Market Saturation?
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: Qiagen recently achieved the 4,000th placement of its QIAcube Connect instrument and announced the launch of the EZ2 DNA Investigator Sep&Prep Kit. Qiagen's outlook anticipates $2.5 billion in revenue and $554.3 million in earnings by 2028. The company still faces headwinds from margin pressures and weak capital spending.

articles.title: Harnessing AI to transform healthcare delivery
articles.author: Matt Saxsma
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a powerful tool in healthcare. Refine Health uses AI-powered ambient listening software to automate the documentation process. It's essential that policymakers recognize the promise of AI and create space for it to evolve in the healthcare industry.

articles.title: Raising a brow at beauty app scores [opinion]
articles.author: Lori Borgman
articles.summary: Beauty analysis apps score your face on a scale of 1-10. Lori Borgman has a vested interest in this phenomenon as she has 11 grandchildren, four of whom are teens. She thinks the apps prey on insecurities of tweens and teens.

articles.title: Agriculture vs. Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: BCCD
articles.summary: ChatGPT and Generative Artificial Intelligence are buzzwords in the media this time. I'm skeptical about their applications on farm life. Most livestock farmers deal with only A.I. technology for now. They use it out of necessity because of the need for labor and lack of laborers.

articles.title: Enhancing AI ROI: Transitioning from Virtual Assistant to Strategic Content Writer The improved title emphasizes the shift from using AI as virtual assistants to strategic content writers, underscorin
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: AI ROI Stalls as Data Access Remains Top Hurdle For Enterprises. 91% of organizations report that their data isn't readily available for AI applications. Organizations with strong data governance protocols are 38% more likely to report successful AI implementations, according to Deloitte.

articles.title: Crypto sleeps while AI builds the richest data set monopolies
articles.author: Daily Truth Report
articles.summary: The decentralized crypto industry faces a critical crossroads. Despite a decade of promoting financial and protocol decentralization, the industry largely overlooks the foundational issue of data. AI companies are rapidly increasing their data monopolies and they are threatening the decentralization of the crypto industry.

articles.title: Commentary: AI won't give American children the education they need
articles.author: Michael R Bloomberg
articles.summary: U.S. officials are waking up to the educational harms of mobile phones in public schools. New York City removed them from schools nearly 20 years ago. Google and other tech companies started promising personalized learning and improved academic performance by getting low-cost laptops into schools more than a decade ago, but it didn't work out well for them.

articles.title: Dracula: Radu Jude's Wild, 3-Hour Satirical Take
articles.author: Marina Collins
articles.summary: Radu Jude's new film 'Dracula' uses artificial intelligence to explore the anxieties and absurdities of our automated world. Jude is known for his sharp critiques of Romanian society and sociopolitical trends. Jude's use of AI foreshadows a broader trend in the art world of generative art.

articles.title: The Trust Factor: Navigating the Ethical Challenges of Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: thecableng
articles.summary: Itunu Ijila is a software developer and AI researcher with a master's degree in artificial intelligence. She builds and codes intelligent applications that bridge technology and everyday life. She explores the issue of bias in AI systems, the importance of human oversight, and the need for ethical guidelines.

articles.title: Bill Gates warning on AI: Tons of investments will be dead ends and ...
articles.author: TOI Tech Desk
articles.summary: Bill Gates has warned that AI investments will be 'dead ends' during an appearance on CNBC's "Squawk Box". He compared the AI bubble to the dot-com era when several internet-based companies became overvalued, leading to a significant crash. MIT study claims that 95% of organizations are getting zero return on their AI investments.

articles.title: Prompt Engineering Newest Technique Is Verbalized Sampling That Stirs AI To Be Free-Thinking And Improve Your Responses
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: In this column, I examine a new technique in prompt engineering. It's a way of prodding generative AI and large language models (LLMs) toward a freer form of answering questions and composing responses. This analysis is part of my ongoing Forbes column coverage on the latest in AI.

articles.title: Two Billion Live with Vision Impairment -- Can AI Help Prevent Sight Loss?
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Planet Classroom's original series AI for a Better World releases Pearse Keane: The Moorfields Mission. It's a focused interview on the urgent global challenge of avoidable vision loss and the role of responsible AI in earlier detection, faster triage, and more equitable care.

articles.title: Two Billion Live with Vision Impairment -- Can AI Help Prevent Sight Loss?
articles.author: Planet Classroom Network
articles.summary: Planet Classroom's original series AI for a Better World releases Pearse Keane: The Moorfields Mission. It's a focused interview on the urgent global challenge of avoidable vision loss and the role of responsible AI in earlier detection, faster triage, and more equitable care.

articles.title: Hi Auto: Sales Leader Drives AI Growth in QSR
articles.summary: Crystal Deaderick has been appointed as Head of Sales at Hi Auto, a leader in AI-powered order-taking solutions. Hi Auto's current performance figures – 93% order completion and 96% accuracy across nearly 1,000 drive-thru lanes – are impressive, exceeding the benchmarks identified in their Buyer's Guide (90% completion, 95% accuracy). According to McKinsey, automation technologies have the potential to increase restaurant profitability by up to 15%.

articles.title: 🌱 Patch AM: Bellevue Parks earns perfect score in national accreditation
articles.author: Patch AM Team
articles.summary: Bellevue's Parks & Community Services Department has been reaccredited for the fourth time. Washington's insurance commissioner has issued $828,500 in fines for various violations, including a $5,000 fine against Ying Sun from Bellevue for false statements on life insurance applications. Bellevue's Vision Zero initiative is highlighted as an example of how telecommunications companies can leverage AI to enhance traffic safety.

articles.title: AI Video Learning: YouTube Data Fuels the Boom 🚀
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: There are over 15 million videos scraped from the internet to train AI models. This data collection raises questions about copyright, transparency, and the foundation of the AI boom. The media industry is negotiating licensing agreements with AI platforms, seeking both financial compensation and control over how their content is used. The New York Times is suing OpenAI and Microsoft for unauthorized use of their materials.

articles.title: Tesla Cybercab almost looks production ready in new photos
articles.summary: Tesla's AI team posted a photo of a Cybercab going Animal Style at an In-and-Out drive-through. The Cybercabb's passengers were in costume. The photos suggest that some of the Cybercabs components may already be production-ready.

articles.title: OpenAI Plans Massive Data Center Expansion on Ann Arbor Farmland, Fueling AI Growth and Infrastructure Development
articles.summary: A 250-acre AI data center campus is being planned for Saline Township, Michigan. The project is a collaborative effort between Related Digital, Oracle, and OpenAI. Construction is anticipated to begin in 2026. It will create 2,500 construction jobs, over 450 permanent positions, and 1,500 jobs within the surrounding community. The data center is projected to consume 25% more energy than currently provided by DTE Energy Co. and is expected to double by 2028. Environmentalists are concerned about the potential impact on local neighborhoods, the economy, energy costs, water resources, and the climate.

articles.title: What's next in AI? 5 predictions for 2026 — from cybersecurity to compliance
articles.author: Jordan Anderson
articles.summary: In 2026, AI agents will evolve from experimental tools to essential operational partners. AI regulation will be one of 2026's biggest forces and biggest challenges. Compliance will define who wins and who falls behind in the AI economy. AI will reshape the workforce, collapsing hierarchies and redefining middle management.

articles.title: Let's Ban Human Superintelligence Too!
articles.author: Philip Maymin
articles.summary: More than 65,000 people have signed a statement calling for a ban on the development of artificial superintelligence (ASI). They argue that ASI is bad for humans and should be banned. They also argue for a limit on human intelligence, especially education.

articles.title: Brain-Inspired Computer Prototype Unveiled by Researchers
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Neuromorphic computing could be the answer to artificial intelligence (AI) systems. It uses brain-inspired computer hardware that could perform AI tasks much more efficiently with far fewer training computations using much less power than conventional systems. Neuromorphic computers integrate memory storage with processing, which allows them to perform AI operations with much greater efficiency and lower costs.

articles.title: Government Seeks Private Backers To Deploy AI To Protect Electric Grid
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Government researchers are seeking to commercialize a unique use of AI to detect cyber attacks and physical problems with the electrical grid, using AI technology.      Â   .   in this case, AI could be used to prevent cyber attacks.

articles.title: Digital Transformation, AI On Agenda At AELM Today
articles.author: Malaysian National News Agency
articles.summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim will share "Preparing a Future-Ready Asia Pacific" at AELM in Gyeongjeongju, South Korea today. He will be joined by Nor Baizura Basri and other leaders.

articles.title: São Paulo Customer Support Associate: Role Focused on Content Writing, Not Virtual Assistance
articles.author: Omar El Sayed
articles.summary: Wise is expanding its Customer Support operations in São Paulo, Brazil. The current recruitment drive specifically targets individuals fluent in both English and Portuguese. The number of Portuguese speakers globally reached approximately 258 million in 2023. The position involves flexible working hours and a consistent five-day work week structure of 36 hours. The company offers a comprehensive benefits package.

articles.title: William Blair Maintains a Buy on Tyler Technologies (TYL)
articles.author: Talha Qureshi
articles.summary: Tyler Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:TYL) is one of the . On October 30, Jonathan Ho from William Blair maintained a Buy rating on TYL. The rating follows the company's fiscal third-quarter results released on October 29. Tyler Technologies provides integrated software and technology solutions tailored for the public sector.

articles.title: AI Chips For The Future
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI transformation depends on specialized chip innovation. Power, cooling, cost, and design speed drive the next hardware era for AI technology.      Â   for more information, go to: http://www.techcrunch.com/article/ai-transformation-relates-to-specialized-chip-innovation.

articles.title: AI Chips For The Future
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is remaking industries at a rapid clip. It's not a coincidence that Nvidia has eclipsed both Apple and Microsoft within the last year to become King in America's tech market. Qualcomm announced its plan to rival the front-runner in AI chip production and the company's stock went up 11%.

articles.title: CrowdStrike & NVIDIA's open source AI gives enterprises the edge against machine-speed attacks
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: CrowdStrike and NVIDIA are working together to create autonomous agents powered by Charlotte AI and NVIDIA Nemotron models. The partnership is designed to enable autonomous agents to learn quickly, reducing risks, threats, and false positives. CrowdStrike's agentic ecosystem combines Charlotte AI AgentWorks, NVIDIA Nemo Agent Toolkit, and NVIDIA NIM microservices.

articles.title: AI-powered muscles made from lifelike materials perform safe actions
articles.author: Prabhat Ranjan Mishra
articles.summary: Researchers from Georgia Institute of Technology used hierarchically structured fibers, which are flexible materials built in layers. Their technology is capable of learning from the body and can adapt in the real time. It helps create motion that feels natural, responsive, and safe enough to support recovery.

articles.title: Gaming billionaire: Prepare for AI to 'completely disrupt everything' across the industry
articles.author: Lucy Handley
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is set to have a huge impact on the gaming industry, according to Min-Liang Tan, the billionaire CEO and co-founder of gaming firm Razer. Razer has developed Game Co-AI, a tool that uses computer vision to "watch" how a gamer plays and provides tips on solving quests or defeating enemies. AI will also be able to detect and fix bugs when games are developed.

articles.title: AI-powered muscles made from lifelike materials learn from body, perform safe actions
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: Researchers in the U.S. developed AI-powered muscles made from lifelike materials paired with intelligent control systems. Their technology is claimed to be capable of learning from the body and can adapt in the real time. This helps create motion that feels natural, responsive and safe.

articles.title: They Want You Relying On Artificial Intelligence So That You Will Lose Your Natural Intelligence, ...
articles.author: The Unz Review
articles.summary: Your rulers want you to rely on AI to do your reasoning, researching, analysis, and writing. They want to require easily controllable software to form your understanding of the world and to express that understanding to you. This product will do it for you.

articles.title: Gaming billionaire: Prepare for AI to 'completely disrupt everything' across the industry
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Razer CEO Min-Liang Tan believes AI can help game developers and testers as well as game players.    iReport.com will let you know more about Razer's new AI technology. iReport will send you a link to it later.

articles.title: Relying on AI at work has limits
articles.summary: Judges around the world are dealing with AI-generated legal briefs with errors. French data scientist and lawyer, Damien Charlotin, catalogued at least 490 court filings in the past six months that contained false or misleading information. AI overviews that appear at the top of web search result pages frequently contain errors. Workers in all industries need to be cautious about the details they upload or put into prompts to ensure they're safeguarding confidential information.

articles.title: Time To Put The Brakes On AI
articles.author: Karen Engstrom
articles.summary: 50 fifty state attorneys general warn that Artificial Intelligence is a danger. They express concern about AI generated data related to law enforcement, healthcare, employment, educational content, election results, sexual predation of children, and digital surveillance. IEA projects that electricity demand from data centres worldwide is set to more than double by 2030 to around 945 terawatt-hours (TWh).

articles.title: Now, AI at work to spot in-house human talent
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: The landscape of talent identification is undergoing a seismic shift thanks to artificial intelligence. Organisations are pivoting from looking for talent to looking for people based on their behaviour rather than their physical appearance.      Â  “Artificial intelligence” is changing the nature of the talent identification process.

articles.title: Intuition Founder Criticizes AI Training on Inferior Data
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: Intuition's Billy Luedtke highlights concerns about AI models being trained on low-quality data. He also highlights the potential risks of recursively AI learning. Intuition is concerned about the lack of quality data being used to train AI models.

articles.title: Money Matters: The Human Edge: 5 skills you need to stay relevant in the Age of AI
articles.summary: AI is changing the nature of work for everyone, from analysts to electricians. If you want to thrive in this new era, you'll need to sharpen distinctly human skills that machines can't yet replicate. Amazon now employs more robots than humans, with over 2 million machines working alongside 1.5 million people. Amazon's robotics team is determined to automate 75% of its operations.

articles.title: AI company protests Lordstown's proposed ban
articles.summary: Lordstown's proposed ban on artificial intelligence data centers has come under question. Council is scheduled to vote on the legislation on Monday. Bristolville 25 Developer LLC wants to build a $3.6 billion campus south of the former GM complex. The proposed site covers 98.68 acres in Lordstown and 34.38 acres in Jackson Township.

articles.title: Tried and true ways to dull the pain of reality
articles.author: Georgia Garvey
articles.summary: The world is going to end on November 1, 2025 and people are worried about it. Here are some tips on how to get yourself over the hump until things turn around or the world ends, depending on the situation you're in at the time. The tips include the Law of Attraction, Mirror affirmations, Quantum healing, Vision boarding and positive thinking.

articles.title: The storm is coming
articles.author: Jim Thompson
articles.summary: Amazon will cut at least 14,000 jobs. Microsoft will cut 6,000. Chevron plans to cut 15-20% of global workforce by the end of 2026. Target is eliminating 1,800 corporate jobs. Morgan Stanley has announced a hiring freeze. Jim Thompson is a columnist for The Highland County Press.
